description: Listed only by Wedgwood, who says: There is a stop named Tuba Shofar at the Temple, Washington, U.S.A. (Kimball Co.). It is a heavy pressure, non-harmonic Tuba, rough and strident in tone, especially so in the treble. The bodies are variously �trimmed short.� The shofar is an ancient Jewish trumpet made from a ram's horn. Bibliography Wedgwood[1]: Tuba Shofar. FOOTER Original site compiled by Edward L. Stauff.
